answers.answer: Hello youHello deebrownSame problem like you,but my rash looks a little bit different.We had a sunny day yesterday,I was lying outside and I got those red itchy and burning hive bumps on my dorsal hands and arms and my feet were swollen from the urticaria plus sunburn on the back and some acne in face.But I also tanned very fast :0)Today it is better again but my skin is very sensitive in general,when it is extremely cold outside I also get a bit itching and hives,but more in the sun.I have solar urticaria for 3 years now,also with some mild skin changes but hives don`t last very long luckily.How long did your hive lasted??I thinkt that Lupus lasts longer than simple sun allergy...Have you done tests so far?yours sweetwoman :)

The hives from cold do not last very long maybe 30 mins but the rash I get from the sun lasts for awhile...like a few days.  Then it will fade a lil then as soon as i go back out in sun it is back an usually worse.  It is really annoying.  My rash from sun is very different from the hives that I experience with cold.  I put pix on my page of the hives and of the rash.  The sun rash is more red and raised round areas as where the cold is hives and they itch like crazy then go away.  Thank you for your help!  God Bless you!

HelloMy rash is similar ,the cold rash is only minimal and it is more kind of dry skin,also only when  it is extremely cold,I freeze and it is very dry outside.The sun rash is similar and more reddish also in my case.Do you  have also skin sensitive to rubbing,contact,pressure,working etc...on the hand and arms?yours sweetwoman

my cold rash is hives like i took medicine that I am allergic to....I do not have and pressure rash etc.  The sun rash just started this year but it is very annoying because I love the sun.  I am a shut in in the winter because the hives get really bad the more exposure that I have to the cold and now this rash in the summer is not leaving many options.  I also get very sick in the sun.  All of my symptoms are exaserbated 100 times.  About a week ago I was stuck in traffic and it was really hot outside.  I became so ill I went home and slept for 2 days.  These symptoms are crazy and I am just sick of dealing with it all...lol.  Thanks for trying to help me!!:)

HelloI also have such strange problems,sometimes also shortness of breath when it is warm and hot outside and last year I got my first  little "sunshock" since I am a child with some kind of dizziness to my brain.When it is very cold than the hives are due to dry skin but in sun they also burn a bit and there is far more skin problems,in winter almost no and the best for my skin is humid weather.But does your skin problem look like urticaria?Because urticaria can be expression of almost every skin disease, for example but not only allergies.yours sweetwoman :0)

I am not sure what you mean by urticaria.  I was under the impression urticaria was hive like what I get when I get cold.  More like and allergic reaction.  The sun rash will start out just really red skin(within 3 mins of sun exposure).  The red raised areas will start soon after...before I know it they will be all over me where the sun is shining on me.  Here is a list of symptomsBells Palsy(1993 and again in 96)Severe vertigo( started in 2004 let up some then returned in 2009 and hasnt left)Cold urticaria(2003the rest all occurred as of april of 09Severe leg weaknessmuscle twitches, cramping and general pain in musclesUveitis(eye problem)EXTREME fatiguerapid heart rate at timesvery cold hands and feetfeet were cold and sweating in 100 degree heatmolting of my skin on legs (livedo reticularis)rash with sunwhen outside in heat I  become more illsymptoms seem much worse around menstrual cyclelow back pain(almost in tail bone)lost menstrual cycle for 6 months( I have always been regular)sporadic menses nowvery dry skinunable to close my eyes with feet together( will fall so when I am in the shower I have to shampoo hair with eyes open)spacey feeling almost as if I am drunkataxiaand the list goes on........I have seen numerous doctors and NOONE has been able to dx me.  I am seeing a new rheumy next month and I am hoping agaist all hope that he listens to me....Hope this helps you understand more about me....Thanks for reading all of thisDawn

Hi Dee - that sounds soooo uncomfortable. It looks it too from your pix. Do your docs have any explanation at all? 'Hives' just isn't good enough in the context of all your other signs and sx.Forgive me, but I'm assuming that you've had brain/spine MRIs, bloods for e.g. ANA, dsDNA, thyroid, vit deficiency, lyme etc. And what about missing periods? What's going on there?!I do hope your new rheumie does a proper job and thoroughly too.  This is such an auto-immune type set of sx...@sweetwoman - Urticaria is just about synonymous with hives.hugssammxxxhttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/SURVIVING-NEUROLOGICAL-LIMBO-LAND---NO-DX/How-long-have-you-been-in-limboland-without-a-satisfactory--conclusive-dx/show/1236589

Hi Silkcut!  It is less uncomfortable and more annoying...lol.  I have had a million and one tests and nothing comes back weird.  Maybe a few things were off but nothing that is eye catching.  My ANA was negative and my old rheumy told me that once negative it will always be negative...LOL.....I know better and i do not have a med degree.  When it all started in 2009 I was doing a very strict diet and a lot of aerobics.  I am thinking that triggered it.  It has been over a year now and I still have no answers.  I feel it is auto immune also but making a doctor take me seriously is another issue, even though, all of my friends and family say I look ill.   I look tired and run down because I am.  I have altered my life for this problem so that I can still function on a low level but i will not surrender to it.  I will keep looking for my answer because I know it is there somewhere.  Thanks for your insight!Dawn

@sdeebrown,silkcutYes some  f your symptoms sound similar to mine,,the rapid heart beat, the spacey feelings like I am drunk  sometimes,the skin problem,muscle weakness or twitches.The tail and pelvic bone pain I have also,but not chronic, it is sporadically for some days or weeks and then resolving again quickly.Most  sx are always sporadically in my case..My menstruation also gets irregular very quickly when I change some habits,like the diet or go on a holiday.And I miss about one period in a year,but luckily not for six months,only two,although the hormone levels are quite good.The hypoglycemia feeling with nausea,rapid heart beat and panic attacks also often get worse before the menstruation.Do you have the problem also that many symptoms are kind of related to "blood sugar" (feeling like it is too low) although sugar is always normal, but eating makes it better (such panic attack feelings related to food craving) and do you have psychiatric sx (feeling like being poisoned by drugs) too?My ANA levels were also negative always,same with  the thyroid but maybe there are new autoimmune disorders which are not so easy to diagnose and maybe we have kind of a new disease...I remember that I have heard about  some autoimmune thing  similar to lupus but I forgot the name....

Yes I get the low blood sugar feeling but mine actually is always slightly high but when I eat the skainess goes away.  I have had that for years.  I think I have had a lot of issues that I blew off as stress or normal before the whole picture was painted.  I know there is something not right and I kow it will show up eventually but I am tired of not knowing.  I told my husband that I do not care how serious it is I would rather know.  Not knowing is awful.  My period just stopped and now I have one every other month or so.  I used to think it would be nice to miss a period but it is not.  My hormones are all good too so I have no idea what is causing it.

Yes, maybe we suffer from the same syndrome....you can read my topic in  "Neurological and Autoimmune-something strange going on related to blood sugar"There is a list where I described my disease and maybe you find yourself in there too.My blood sugar is luckily normal but maybe yours is also only to high after eating-then that would be normal.How high is your blood sugar normally,may I ask and do you have diabetes?With that neurological breakdowns related to blood sugar and eating it is the case that they are not that extremely most of the time (I then eat something immediately) but sometimes they come in very bad fits lasting days when I sometimes really feel like dying.The panic attacks came to me very suddenly from one day to another without any appereant reason in 2006 when I was eightteen....Then a year after in summer the rashes came into my life and I also think that there is something systemic going on in my body-although many people say I am crazy or a hypochondriac,because I have the symptoms not always and doctors didn`t find causes for it.I also only want to know whats wrong,at the moment I am quite healthy for a longer time now,but I am also a bit curious what my disease could be and how I can prevent some issues or if there would be a good medicine against my illness...It is not a good feeling if you  always have to be scared when symptoms come back or get worse..Or the fear when you`re waiting for a bloodwork`s result and you are afraid that maybe some organs could be working worse or something else this time...I know that feeling and it makes you a hypochondriac because nobody knows what is going wrong.But I am always glad about good bloodworks,that means that the disease is not killing me and makes no organ damage.Maybe we start a new group for our "syndrome"...Yourssweetwoman :)

Hi Sweet!  I have had diabetes(gestational) and was diagnosed in 2008 with type 2.  I lost 90 pounds and the high sugar wen away.  I have since gained 60 pounds due to illness(mostly not being active) and my sugar is running high again also.  When I first started having the "low sugar feeling" was about 4 years ago.  I just assumed that is what it was because in the past when I had too much insulin I had the same feeling so I would eat and it would pass but i would literally be drained.  i will never forget one night at work it happened and I had to come home because I was so sleepy afterwards I was falling asleep.  My main problem I am suffering from now is vertigo, extreme fatigue, leg weakness.  I cannot walk very far at all without my legs becoming heavy and I become more clumsy.  It is truly a scary feeling.  We can be friends on here if you like.......that way maybe we can help eachother!!:)  I  will request you!

Hello deebrownThank you for inviting me as a friend :)I think if you had gestionic diabetes you maybe should monitor it although you haven`t diabetes now.It would be good to measure the sugar regularly,I also often make check up one time a year  for diabetes type 2 at the doctor because my grandfather has it.Although I am not in a risk group...Best wishes and supportyours sweetwoman :)

question: Hi all!  I havent been on for awhile.  Still feeling bad and no conclusive answers yet.  I recently went outside in the sun and broke out in a rash.  I took some pictures of this and they are on my page.  Can you all take a look at this and tell me what you think?  I have been getting hives when I get cold for about 7 years but now I am breaking out in the sun too.  I have heard that Lupus can cause rashes from the sun but i do not know if what I have looks like a lupus rash or not. Thanks for taking the time to look and hope you all are doing well.Hugs'Dawn
